com.mishmash.alpha
Class Vehicle

java.lang.Object
  com.mishmash.alpha.Vehicle

public class Vehicle
extends java.lang.Object

Reperesents the star of this application, the Vehicle. Vehicles have limited functionality other than to check their own validity (in case they've been given invalid parts) and to calculate the distance that they could travel. Vehicles deliberately don't have setter methods for the parts. If you want to change the parts of a vehicle, create a new vehicle.

Constructor Detail

Vehicle

public Vehicle(VehicleType type,
               Rider rider,
               VehicleFrame vehicleFrame,
               PowerPlant powerPlant,
               java.util.List<Wheel> wheels)
Creates a new vehicle based on the input data.

Parameters:
type - The type of vehicle.
rider - The vehicle's rider.
vehicleFrame - The vehicle's frame.
powerPlant - The vehicle's power plant.
wheels - An list of the vehicle's wheels, ordered front-to-back.
Method Detail

isValid

public boolean isValid()
A lazy validator. Because the Vehicle can't be altered after construction, we only need to check this once.

Returns:
True if all parts are valid for the type of the vehicle and all modifiers have valid values.

getDistance

public double getDistance(ModifierStackingOperation op)
Calculates the distance a vehicle can travel, using whichever stacking operation it is fed.

Parameters:
op - How to stack the modifiers (additively or multiplicatively)
Returns:
The distance traveled.
